title: How can I merge these two weights together? (the weight of Full_Macaque Model Zoo and the video I labeled)
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS
DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.9
Anaconda env used:Anaconda 3-5.3.1-Linux-x86_64
cuda 10.0, 
cudnn 7.6.5, 
tensorflow-gpu = 1.13.1
python = 3.7

**Describe the problem**
I want to use DeepLabCut to recognize the monkey’s body movements. 
 
Firstly, I downloaded the Full_Macaque weight from the DeepLabCut Model Zoo, and then use this weight to recognize the macaque video that I took. However, the recognition result of my macaque’s body movement video is not that good. 
 
Secondly, I used the DeepLabCut GUI to create a new project, and then labeled 70 pictures of the macaque’s body joint points (The position and order of the points that I labeled are consistent with the Full_Macaque Model Zoo provided). I want to train a new weight.
 
The question is how can I merge these two weights together? 

**How to Reproduce the problem**

1. Go to GUI and create a new project, then I labeled 70 pictures. (I took a macaque video by myself)
2. I closed the GUI. Then I copied the full_macaque weight and renamed into the picture below
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108730784-d4121180-7566-11eb-87b4-5c7f271b0f76.png)
3. I changed many config path. e.g. the path inside the "train/pose_cfg.yamal", "test/pose_cfg.yaml"
4. I typed the code below
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731141-39660280-7567-11eb-87b5-db0d1e7a6e14.png)
5.  After I typed “deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file)” I found that the "init_weights" changed into “/home/yingxuanshi/.conda/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/models/pretrained/resnet_v1_50.ckpt”.
So I changed this line into “/home/yingxuanshi/DeepLabCut-master/Monkey-test2_skle_help-2021-02-22/dlc-models/iteration-0/MonkeyFeb22-trainset95shuffle1/train/snapshot-1030000”
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731219-4f73c300-7567-11eb-8e80-bb22b3413884.png)
6. Then I typed this blew
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731389-7cc07100-7567-11eb-870d-b8c6b554281b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731423-83e77f00-7567-11eb-82d3-f59ff53eb568.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731446-8944c980-7567-11eb-861a-5365209ce6ea.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731473-8ea21400-7567-11eb-8cb3-f4d37b115aa7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731485-9366c800-7567-11eb-8ec1-ca7c02d28cdb.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731516-9a8dd600-7567-11eb-9efc-592889049999.png)
7. Then I want to analyse the new video, so I opened the GUI and selected picture below
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731674-c01adf80-7567-11eb-9d02-5b1da1ff8c80.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54396039/108731685-c315d000-7567-11eb-9608-1b92bb92d829.png)

**Additional context**
I don't think the final video merge two weights together, I think the final video only use the weight of "Full_Macaque Model Zoo". 
I tried many times but I do not know how to merge two training weights together and then generate a new weight. 

Forgave me, I only set the (maxiters = 1500) this time. 
This is because I set (maxiters = 5000) before and did the same experiment, still can't get a better result.
